p: Population accessibility is yet one more important factor. Accessing current PWID or ex‐PWID may prove difficult. 47 Risk of reinfection is another factor, such as for PWID and populations with high‐risk health care exposures. With the recent increasing availability of generic DAA medicines in MENA countries at a cost below $100, such as in Egypt 18, 19 and Pakistan, 20, 21 which are the two most affected countries, effort should be paid to prioritize and target testing and treatment based on the most efficient public health considerations, with a gradual scale‐up to attain universal coverage of all population groups and elimination of HCV as an epidemic of public health concern. Cost‐effectiveness is another consideration, and this varies from one country to another based on actual costs of testing and treatment and the country‐specific cost‐effectiveness threshold as set based on the per‐capita gross domestic product. 74, 75
